definition: to rise again after a fall/to pick up/rally (stock market etc)
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]
variant of 升[sheng1]/to ascend/to rise in rank

sentences.english: The price of potash has already started to recover from declines sparked by the Great Recession.
sentences.chinese: 碳酸钾价格已经从大萧条造成的下跌中回升了。

sentences.english: At the same time, short-term traders bought to reverse bets that stock prices would fall.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，短线交易员逆市买入，押注股价回升。

sentences.english: As temperatures rise, or the advent of strong cold air will gradually weaken.
sentences.chinese: 随着气温回升或者强冷空气来临会逐渐减弱。

sentences.english: Purchasing managers in manufacturing firms also report mounting orders.
sentences.chinese: 在制造业公司的采购经理们也报告了订单数的回升。

sentences.english: As it happens, in that year life expectancy started rising.
sentences.chinese: 因为恰从那年起，人均预期寿命开始回升。

sentences.english: The stock market will soon rally.
sentences.chinese: 股票行情不久即将回升。

sentences.english: The broader stock market has chugged steadily higher since March.
sentences.chinese: 自3月份以来，股市整体稳步回升。

sentences.english: He fell out, and one of the pickup's back tires ran over him.
sentences.chinese: 他跌出，而其中一个回升的回轮胎辗过他。

sentences.english: False bottoms and bear market rallies have trapped investors since time immemorial .
sentences.chinese: 投资者落入谷底假象和熊市止跌回升的陷阱久已有之。

sentences.english: The passenger load factor and revenue rise reflected.
sentences.chinese: 其反映出客座率和收益的回升。

sentences.english: In 1997, its economy finally had positive growth, with a 1% preliminary estimate.
sentences.chinese: 一九九七年经济止跌回升，估计祇有一%成长。

sentences.english: Some charitable organizations say they are optimistic donations will pick back up this year.
sentences.chinese: 一些慈善组织对今年捐款捐物回升持乐观态度。

sentences.english: Deeper water may ever be drawn back toward the surface of the ground by capillarity .
sentences.chinese: 较深处的水甚至也可能由于毛细作用而回升到地面。

sentences.english: The National Association of Realtors is projecting that home sales will trend up this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年全国房地产联合会正在策划房屋买卖的回升。

sentences.english: As soon as the price picks up， enquiries will revive.
sentences.chinese: 一旦价格回升，询盘将恢复活跃。

sentences.english: When the coil temperature rose to 9 degrees or so the end of the cream immediately.
sentences.chinese: 当盘管温度回升至9度左右除霜立即结束。

definition: to fall back/to return to low level after a rise (in water level, price etc)
(of the weather) to warm up again
to decline/to drop/to fall/to go down/to decrease
to slow down/to ease up/to abate/slowdown/downturn
to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
(of a market index etc) to fall below (a given level)/to be injured or damaged as a result of a fall
to clamber up/(of prices etc) to rise
